summary: ScheduleClient does not respect the namespace specified in ClientOptions when creating schedules without explicit ScheduleOptions. Schedules are created in the default namespace instead of the configured namespace.
userImpact: Users cannot create schedules in non-default namespaces using ScheduleClient constructor options, forcing them to always specify namespace explicitly in ScheduleOptions.
rootCause: ScheduleClient hardcodes namespace default to 'default' string in createSchedule method instead of using the namespace from ClientOptions passed to constructor.
proposedFix: Use the namespace provided in ClientOptions as the default in createSchedule, similar to how it's done in getHandle method at line 139.
workaround: Explicitly pass namespace in ScheduleOptions when calling createSchedule: `createSchedule(Schedule::new(), options: ScheduleOptions::new()->withNamespace('my-namespace'))`
resolutionDetails: Issue was closed, indicating the bug was resolved by respecting ClientOptions namespace in ScheduleClient.
keyQuote: When I create a schedule without explicitly passing ScheduleOptions, the schedule is created in the default namespace instead of the namespace provided in ClientOptions
